invoice_currency.description: Invoice currency for the checkout session (in uppercase, iso-4217 standard). By default, the invoice currency is the holding currency for the transaction.

amount.description: Amount in cents. For example if you want to charge $10.12 pass 1012 as the value. For decimal handling for various currencies, refer to the guide here

country.description: ISO 3166 standard alpha-2 code. eg: SG, IN, US, etc.

calling_code.description: Calling country code (for example, '1' for United States, '91' for India)

customer.description: ID of the customer for the checkout session

success_url.description: URL where the customer is directed to after a successful payment

cancel_url.description: The URL the customer will be directed to if they decide to cancel payment and return to your website.

transaction_description.description: A short description to be displayed on the Tazapay hosted checkout screen

calling_code.description: Calling country code (for example, '1' for United States, '91' for India)

label.description: Denotes the type of address (Example - home, work)

calling_code.description: Calling country code (for example, '1' for United States, '91' for India)

label.description: Denotes the type of address (Example - home, work)

metadata.description: Set of key-value pairs that can be attached to the checkout session

reference_id.description: Your unique identifier for the session

confirm.description: Set to `true` to confirm this payin immediately. The parameter defaults to `false`. When creating and confirming a payin at the same time, you can also provide the parameters in the confirm API

statement_descriptor.description: Configure the description of the payment on your customer's statements. It must contain at least one letter and be 1-22 characters long

payment_method_details.description: Pass the data specific to a payment method to confirm a payin and create a payment attempt

session_id.description: Session ID retrieved from the risk SDK

post.description: This lets you create a checkout session for your customer by generating a Tazapay hosted payment page.

invoice_currency.description: Invoice currency for the checkout session (in uppercase, iso-4217 standard). By default, the invoice currency is the holding currency for the transaction.

amount.description: Amount in cents. For example if you want to charge $10.12 pass 1012 as the value. For decimal handling for various currencies, refer to the guide here

country.description: ISO 3166 standard alpha-2 code. eg: SG, IN, US, etc.

calling_code.description: Calling country code (for example, '1' for United States, '91' for India)

customer.description: ID of the customer for the checkout session

success_url.description: URL where the customer is directed to after a successful payment

cancel_url.description: The URL the customer will be directed to if they decide to cancel payment and return to your website.

payment_methods.description: Specify the payment methods you want displayed for the session. If you do not specify, the default payment methods for the country are displayed to the customer

remove_payment_methods.description: Specify the payment methods you want removed for the session

transaction_description.description: A short description to be displayed on the Tazapay hosted checkout screen

calling_code.description: Calling country code (for example, '1' for United States, '91' for India)

label.description: Denotes the type of address (Example - home, work)

calling_code.description: Calling country code (for example, '1' for United States, '91' for India)

label.description: Denotes the type of address (Example - home, work)

expires_at.description: The time at which the checkout session is scheduled to expire. If expired using the expire api, this will contain the time that the checkout session expired at

metadata.description: Set of key-value pairs that can be attached to the checkout session

reference_id.description: Your unique identifier for the session

customer_fee_percentage.description: An integer between 0 and 100. Percentage of processing fee to be paid by the customer. Tazapay will charge the customer an amount inclusive of the processing fee

items.description: List of items in the invoice

name.description: Name of the product the customer wants to buy

quantity.description: The number of the product the customer wants to buy

session_id.description: Session ID retrieved from the risk SDK

Result.value:

post.description: This lets you initiate a payout.

amount.description: Amount in cents. For example if you want to payout $10.12 pass 1012 as the value. For decimal handling for various currencies, refer to the guide here

currency.description: ISO 4217 standard. This is the payout currency. The amount will be in the payout currency

address.description: Beneficiary Address (Mandatory if destination_details.type is a wallet)

calling_code.description: Calling country code (for example, '1' for United States, '91' for India)

bank.description: Bank details if the destination_details.type is a bank account

account_number.description: Bank Account Number. Either account_number or IBAN is mandatory

iban.description: IBAN. Either account_number or iban is mandatory

currency.description: Three-letter ISO currency code, in uppercase

purpose_code.description: Purpose Code for INR bank accounts

firc_required.description: Pass `true` if you want FIRC for a payout to India. By default, it is set to `false`

wallet.description: Wallet details if the destination_details.type is a wallet

local_payment_network.description: Destination details if the destination_details.type is local_payment_network

type.description: Type of the local_payment_network (example - pix_brl, upi_inr, promptpay_thb)

deposit_key_type.description: Type of the deposit key. Conditionally Mandatory depending on the value of type

deposit_key.description: Deposit key corresponding to the type of local payment network (Example, PIX key for PIX, UPI handle for UPI, etc.)

tax_id.description: Tax ID of the beneficiary. (CPF or CPNJ number is mandatory for payouts to Brazil)

registration_number.description: Registration number of the business (Mandatory if destination_details.type is a wallet and type is business)

date_of_birth.description: Date of birth of individual, Format DD-MM-YYYY (Mandatory if destination_details.type is a wallet and type is individual)

party_classification.description: Type of relationship between beneficiary and creator of beneficiary Possible values - self, third_party (Mandatory if destination_details.type is a wallet)

beneficiary.description: ID of an existing payout beneficiary

holding_currency.description: ISO 4217 standard, in uppercase. This is one of your balance currencies whose balance will fund the payout.

metadata.description: Set of key-value pairs to attach to the payout object

purpose.description: Reason for payout. Click here for the detailed list.

reference_id.description: Reference ID of the payout on your system

type.description: A string mentioning the type of document. Possible values - invoice, other

on_behalf_of.description: ID of the entity the payout is created on behalf of

logistics_tracking_details.description: Logistics tracking details of the order

logistics_provider_code.description: Code of logistics provider (e.g. DHL, FDX, etc.)

destination_fx_quote.description: ID of the quote to use locked exchange for conversion from payout to destination currency

quote.description: Quote ID from the payout quote API

parameters.name: id

post.description: Fund a payout which is in requires_funding

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of a payout in the state `requires_funding`

post.description: Creates an escrow between two parties

amount.description: Amount in cents. For decimal handling for various currencies, refer to the guide here

country.description: ISO 3166 standard alpha-2 code. eg: SG, IN, US, etc.

calling_code.description: Calling country code (for example, '1' for United States, '91' for India)

customer.description: ID of the customer for the checkout session

success_url.description: URL where the customer is directed to after a successful payment

cancel_url.description: The URL the customer will be directed to if they decide to cancel payment and return to your website.

webhook_url.description: Account's URL where Tazapay will send webhooks

payment_methods.description: Specify the payment methods you want displayed for the session. If you do not specify, the default payment methods for the country are displayed to the customer

remove_payment_methods.description: Payment Methods to be REMOVED for the session

transaction_description.description: A short description to be displayed on the Tazapay hosted checkout screen

calling_code.description: Calling country code (for example, '1' for United States, '91' for India)

label.description: Denotes the type of address (Example - home, work)

calling_code.description: Calling country code (for example, '1' for United States, '91' for India)

label.description: Denotes the type of address (Example - home, work)

expires_at.description: The time at which the redirection session for the escrow is scheduled to expire. If expired using the expire api, this will contain the time that the escrow session expired at

metadata.description: Set of key-value pairs that can be attached to the escrow

reference_id.description: Your unique identifier for the escrow

customer_fee_percentage.description: An integer between 0 and 100. Percentage of processing fee to be paid by the customer. Tazapay will charge the customer an amount inclusive of the processing fee

items.description: List of items in the invoice

session_id.description: Session ID retrieved from the risk SDK

post.description: This endpoint cancels an already existing refund object

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the existing refund object to be cancelled

get.description: This allows you to check the collection methods available for a given buyer/seller country. This also shows the supported collection methods for the invoice currency and country corridor, the banks and type of accounts that will be available.

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: Amount in cents. For example if you want to charge $10.12 pass 1012 as the value. For decimal handling for various currencies, refer to the guide here

parameters.name: invoice_currency
parameters.description: Invoice currency, ISO 4217 standard specifies three-letter ("Alpha-3") codes. e.g. USD

parameters.name: customer_country
parameters.description: ISO 3166 standard alpha-2 code. eg: SG, IN, US

get.description: Fetch Account Details using the tax ID

parameters.name: country
parameters.description: ISO 3166 standard alpha-2 code. eg: SG, IN, US, etc.

parameters.name: tax_id
parameters.description: Tax ID the account is linked to

get.description: Retrieve exchange rate between currency pairs

parameters.name: initial_currency
parameters.description: ISO 4217 standard specifies three-letter ("Alpha-3") codes. e.g. USD

parameters.name: final_currency
parameters.description: ISO 4217 standard specifies three-letter ("Alpha-3") codes. e.g. USD

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: Amount in cents. For example if you want to charge $10.12 pass 1012 as the value. For decimal handling for various currencies, refer to the guide here

get.description: This allows you to check the requirements with respect to bank fields for a given beneficiary country. These requirements will be made live on 30th April 2025, merchants must adhere to these requirements and update the integration on or before the deadline.

parameters.name: country
parameters.description: 2-letter ISO country code. For e.g. US for United States

parameters.name: currency
parameters.description: 3-letter currency code. For e.g. USD

url.description: Dynamically downloadable URL for document OR Shipment tracking URL

name.description: Name of the type in case the type is 'other'

reference.description: ID of the object for which the document is being submitted (checkout, escrow, payin)

description.description: Additional information about the document uploaded

metadata.description: Set of key-value pairs to attach to the document

get.description: Refers to each attempt by the customer to pay using a particular payment method

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the payment attempt

metadata.description: Set of key-value pairs to attach with the payment attempt object

post.description: This lets you create a beneficiary

address.description: Address (Mandatory if destination_details.type is a wallet)

calling_code.description: Calling country code (for example, '1' for United States, '91' for India)

bank.description: Bank details if the destination_details.type is a bank account

account_number.description: Bank Account Number. Either account_number or IBAN is mandatory

iban.description: IBAN. Either account_number or iban is mandatory

currency.description: Three-letter ISO currency code, in uppercase

purpose_code.description: Purpose Code for INR bank accounts

firc_required.description: Pass `true` if you want FIRC for a payout to India. By default, it is set to `false`

wallet.description: Wallet details if the destination_details.type is a wallet

local_payment_network.description: Destination details if the destination_details.type is local_payment_network

type.description: Type of the local_payment_network (example - pix_brl, upi_inr, promptpay_thb)

deposit_key_type.description: Type of the deposit key. Conditionally Mandatory depending on the value of type

deposit_key.description: Deposit key corresponding to the type of local payment network (Example, PIX key for PIX, UPI handle for UPI, etc.)

deposit_address.description: Deposit Address corresponding to a Tazapay account

tazapay_account.description: Destination details if the destination_details.type is tazapay_account

destination.description: ID of the destination attached to the beneficiary

metadata.description: Set of key-value pairs to attach to the beneficiary

tax_id.description: Tax ID of the beneficiary. (CPF or CPNJ is mandatory for payouts to Brazil)

documents.description: Documents to attach to the beneficiary

type.description: A string mentioning the type of document (example - shareholding_pattern)

registration_number.description: Registration number of the business (Mandatory if destination_details.type is a wallet and type is business)

date_of_birth.description: Date of birth of individual, Format DD-MM-YYYY (Mandatory if destination_details.type is a wallet and type is individual)

party_classification.description: Type of relationship between beneficiary and creator of beneficiary Possible values - self, third_party (Mandatory if destination_details.type is a wallet)

get.description: This lets you fetch an existing beneficiary

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the existing beneficiary

put.description: This lets you update an existing beneficiary

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the exisitng beneficiary

calling_code.description: Calling country code (for example, '1' for United States, '91' for India)

bank.description: Bank details if the destination_details.type is a bank account

account_number.description: Bank Account Number. Either account_number or IBAN is mandatory

iban.description: IBAN. Either account_number or iban is mandatory

currency.description: Three-letter ISO currency code, in uppercase

purpose_code.description: Purpose Code for INR bank accounts

firc_required.description: Pass `true` if you want FIRC for a payout to India. By default, it is set to `false`

wallet.description: Wallet details if the destination_details.type is a wallet

local_payment_network.description: Destination details if the destination_details.type is local_payment_network

type.description: Type of the local_payment_network (example - pix_brl, upi_inr, promptpay_thb)

deposit_key_type.description: Type of the deposit key. Conditionally Mandatory depending on the value of type

deposit_key.description: Deposit key corresponding to the type of local payment network (Example, PIX key for PIX, UPI handle for UPI, etc.)

metadata.description: Set of key-value pairs to attach to the beneficiary

tax_id.description: Tax ID of the beneficiary. (CPF or CPNJ is mandatory for payouts to Brazil)

type.description: A string mentioning the type of document (example - shareholding_pattern)

get.description: Provides real-time access to available funds across multiple currenices

Provides real-time, detailed insights into individual balance movements, including charges, currency conversions, and adjustments, allowing you to track all credits and debits across multiple currencies

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the balance transaction you want to expand

post.description: Create a sub-entity for your account

description.description: A short description of the business

calling_code.description: Calling country code (for example, '1' for United States, '91' for India)

submit.description: true or false, default is false

date_of_birth.description: Date of birth of the representative, in format "DD-MM-YYYY"

nationality.description: Two-letter country code, in ISO format

calling_code.description: Calling country code (for example, '1' for United States, '91' for India)

ownership_percentage.description: Ownership percent, two digits after decimal is allowed

roles.description: Representative's role. Can be one or more than one of these: 'director', 'shareholder', 'beneficial_owner', 'authorised_signatory', 'authorised_representative', or 'other'

description.description: A short description of the document submitted
A short description about the document uploaded

reference_id.description: Merchant's internal reference ID for the entity

metadata.description: Set of key-value pairs to attach to the entity

purpose_of_use.description: The capabilities the entity intends to use. Possible values - `collect`, `payout`. In case you only want to add global collection account on behalf of the entity, pass collect. If you want to only make payouts on behalf of the entity, use `payout`. In case you want to do both, pass `["collect","payout"]`

onboarding_package_url.description: Link to the complete onboarding package for the entity

on_behalf_of.description: ID of the entity this entity is created on behalf of

ending_before.description: A cursor for use in pagination. Takes an object as input

limit.description: The number of objects to be fetched, by default 10, can be from 1 to 100

starting_after.description: A cursor for use in pagination. Takes an object as input

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Tazapay unique ID of the entity

nationality.description: Two-letter country code, in ISO format

calling_code.description: Calling country code (for example, '1' for United States, '91' for India)

ownership_percentage.description: Ownership percent, two digits after decimal is allowed

roles.description: Representative's role. Can be one or more than one of these: 'director', 'shareholder', 'beneficial_owner', 'authorised_signatory', 'authorised_representative', or 'other'

description.description: A short description of the document submitted
A short description about the document uploaded

metadata.description: Set of key-value pairs to attach to the entity

purpose_of_use.description: The capabilities the entity intends to use. Possible values - `collect`, `payout`. In case you only want to add global collection account on behalf of the entity, pass collect. If you want to only make payouts on behalf of the entity, use `payout`. In case you want to do both, pass `["collect","payout"]`

initial_currency.description: 3 Letter Currency Code, in ISO format

initial_amount.description: Amount in cents. For decimal handling for various currencies, refer to the guide here

final_currency.description: 3 Letter Currency Code, in ISO format

converted_amount.description: Amount in cents. For decimal handling for various currencies, refer to the guide here

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the quote

type.description: Type of Collection Account. This can be either virtual account or wallet.

on_behalf_of.description: Incase you want to open this account on behalf of a entity. Please add the entity id.

Description.description: Describe the usecase for the requested account

currencies.description: List of currencies, you want to enable for your account. Use the metadata api to get the set of currencies you can enable in one account.

country.description: Virtual Account Location - The country in which you are requesting VA. Format - ISO 3166 standard alpha-2 code. eg: SG, IN, US, etc.

payment_method_type.description: Payment Method Type used for the account. Refer https://docs.tazapay.com/update/docs/collection-accounts-payment-method-type#

code-samples.name: Virtual Account Request
Wallet Request

metadata.usecase: This account is used for USD payouts

metadata.description: Key Value pairs that you want to attach to your collections account

payout_type.description: Type of the payout. Possible values - `swift`, `local`, `local_payment_network`, `wallet`, `tazapay_account`

fund_transfer_network.description: Type of the fund_transfer_network (example - chats in HK).

local.description: Object containing additional details if the payout_type is local

amount.description: Amount in cents. For decimal currency handling, refer to this.
Amount in cents. For decimal currency handling, refer to this.

country.description: Two letter country code - in ISO format / Represents beneficiary bank country

destination_info.description: Amount in destination currency (currency in which beneficiary receives the funds)

type.description: Type of the local payment network

local_payment_network.description: Object containing additional details if the payout type is local_payment_network

wallet.description: Object containing additional details if the payout type is wallet

swift.description: Object containing additional details if the payout_type is `swift

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the payout

source.description: ID of the collect to fund the payout

file_name.description: File Name of the document that needs to be uploaded

url.description: Pre-signed url where the document needs to be uploaded. The url will only be valid for 1 hour.

parameters.name: file_name
parameters.description: File Name of the document that needs to be uploaded.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: This specifies a limit on the number of objects to return, ranging between 1 and 100.

parameters.name: starting_after
parameters.description: A cursor to use in pagination. starting_after is an object ID that defines your place in the list. For example, if you make a list request and receive 100 objects, ending with obj_foo, your subsequent call can include starting_after=obj_foo to fetch the next page of the list.

parameters.name: ending_before
parameters.description: A cursor to use in pagination. ending_before is an object ID that defines your place in the list. For example, if you make a list request and receive 100 objects, starting with obj_bar, your subsequent call can include ending_before=obj_bar to fetch the previous page of the list.
